text: So MindBody, I always like to say

that it's business in a
box, a total solution
for yoga studios, fitness centers, spas,
salons, and the like.

We had 60,000 databases at
the time of our migration,

and they were all on
standalone database servers
in a data center that wasn't redundant
and frankly,
could have spelled disaster at any time.
By moving to AWS we were able to add a,
not just a high availability,

but we were also able to
improve on our disaster recovery

as well by leveraging multiple
availability zones within

the local zone in
the region that we are in

to protect not just our data,
but our customers as well.

The Optimization and Licensing
Assessment program that we went

through, or OLA. The OLA
was able to highlight some

of our licensing issues that
we knew we had over licensing,
over provisioning, things like that.
Because we're in the cloud

and we're able to
embrace that elasticity,

we've greatly reduced
our internal incidents.
We have definitely improved our RTO

and RPO in terms of being
able to, at a factor

of about 400% improve on
our ability to recover faster.

On top of that, we wanted
to be able to modernize
on cloud native technologies

and look at moving away
from the licensing structure

of Microsoft, both for the
OS and for SQL Server itself.

We would've never been able
to do that without the support

and the trust that that we
had with working with AWS.
